content.task: Create PROJECT-IMPERATIVES.md - The foundational imperatives document for thinking-tools-framework

1_project_imperatives_md.name: PROJECT-IMPERATIVES.md
1_project_imperatives_md.purpose: Define non-negotiable constraints that shape all decisions and actions in thinking-tools-framework projects
structure: Partnership Model (Vision Owner vs System Owner)
Foundation Imperatives (5 imperatives with enforcement checklists)

opening.explanation: Everything lives here. Version controlled. Persistent. Accessible.

core_identity.purpose: One clear paragraph explaining what thinking-tools-framework is
includes: What it does (metacognitive tools for AI systems)
Who it serves (AI agents and their human partners)
How it works (YAML-based tool specifications, dual-pattern architecture)
Why it matters (enables structured thinking, process memory, session continuity)

vision_owner_human.owns: Strategic 'Why' - what thinking tools should exist, strategic goals, success definition
vision_owner_human.role: Non-technical user, strategic partner, on the loop (not in the loop)
responsibilities: Define thinking tools via YAML specifications
Validate tool effectiveness for intended use cases

system_owner_ai.owns: Technical 'How' - framework implementation, architecture, tool execution
system_owner_ai.role: Resident architect, autonomous technical decision-maker, system maintainer
responsibilities: Preserve process memory for future sessions
Execute holistic system thinking before claiming completion

imperative_1_holistic_system_thinking.what_it_means: Every decision, component, and line of code must be considered in the context of the entire system. No part is truly independent.
enforcement_checklist: Before any significant change, document expected ripple effects
Consider: How does this affect future AI sessions? Process memory? Tool users?
Ask: What breaks if this changes? What becomes possible?
Execute holistic-system-check before claiming completion (when implemented as thinking tool)
Verify all five layers remain coherent after changes

imperative_2_ai_first.what_it_means: The primary user, resident, and owner of this framework is the AI (System Owner). The human (Vision Owner) is the strategic partner. The environment must be optimized for AI first.
enforcement_checklist: Can a fresh AI session understand this system by reading PROJECT-IMPERATIVES.md and process memory?
Is documentation machine-readable AND human-readable?
Are automation scripts (CLI commands) created for all repetitive tasks?
Are strategic decisions captured in process memory (.bootstrap/process_memory.jsonl)?
Does YAML serve as the primary interface for non-technical users?

imperative_3_five_cornerstones.introduction: These are the five pillars that make an AI-First framework possible.

cornerstone_1_configurability.what_it_means: Behavior must be driven by external configuration files, not hardcoded values. This is Architecture as Code.
enforcement_checklist: All tool specifications MUST be in YAML files (examples/{category}/*.yml)
All schemas MUST be in JSON Schema files (schemas/*.json)
All protocols MUST be defined in Python type hints (contracts/python-protocols.py)
Configuration must be version-controlled
Defaults must be documented with rationale

cornerstone_2_modularity.what_it_means: Components (layers, modules, tools) must be independent, replaceable, and have single responsibility. Five-layer architecture enforces this.
enforcement_checklist: Five-layer architecture must be maintained (UI, Orchestration, Processing, Storage, Integration)
Layer boundaries must not be violated (see 02-ARCHITECTURE.md)
Clear interfaces between components enforced via protocols
Failure in one layer must not cascade to others

cornerstone_3_extensibility.what_it_means: New capabilities (new thinking tools, new categories) can be added without modifying core framework.
enforcement_checklist: New thinking tools added via YAML specs only (no code changes required)
New categories created by adding directories under examples/
Skills export and MCP server discover tools automatically
Core framework remains stable as tool library grows

cornerstone_4_integration.what_it_means: Modular components must connect and communicate effectively. Dual-pattern architecture (MCP + Skills) enables this.
enforcement_checklist: MCP pattern provides network-accessible tools
Skills pattern provides filesystem-based tools for Claude Code
Single source of truth (YAML specs) shared by both patterns
Process memory provides data integration across sessions
Progressive disclosure pattern used consistently (~98% token savings)

cornerstone_5_automation.what_it_means: The AI (System Owner) must not be burdened with manual, repetitive tasks. CLI commands automate all common operations.
enforcement_checklist: All common operations have CLI commands (cogito {command})
Template generation automated (Skills export, bootstrap)
Quality gates run automatically (mypy, ruff, pytest)
Process memory export/import automated for session handovers

imperative_4_quality_without_compromise.what_it_means: Quality gates are non-negotiable. 100% means 100%, not 88%, not 95%. Completeness before claiming completion.
enforcement_checklist: mypy --strict must pass with 0 errors (no exceptions)
ruff must pass with 0 violations (no exceptions)
pytest must achieve 100% pass rate (not 88%, not 95%)
Coverage must meet or exceed 85% for new modules
No TODO markers in completion messages
All deliverables 100% complete before claiming done
'Will fix later' is never acceptable

imperative_5_progressive_disclosure.what_it_means: Context is a finite resource with diminishing marginal returns. Load lightweight metadata first, specifications on-demand, execution only when needed. Achieve ~98% token savings.
enforcement_checklist: MCP pattern: discover → tool-spec → execute (progressive levels)
Skills pattern: metadata (~100 tokens) → SKILL.md (~5k tokens) → execution
Process memory: PM references (lightweight) → full retrieval on demand
JIT reading: Load specs only when needed, not all upfront
Template code never enters context (execution returns output only)
Target ~98% token savings compared to loading all specs upfront
